ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Excellent course. I am not interested in campaign work at all but I am so glad that I took this class. It has helped me become more articulate about several environmental issues. It has also helped me become a more effective communicator. Readings were great, very useful. The workload was slightly above average - readings, weekly papers, huge final project but definitely worth it.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Getting to understand the breadth of knowledge that each speaker brought to their respective lecture was one of the best aspects of this course. I had the opportunity to interact with them in a small group setting and outside the classroom, and I thought it was a great way to really delve into campaigning and to network.
Hearing from so many guest speakers and being able to have a conversation with them!
The guest speakers were excellent and I really enjoyed the simulation of a campaign planning meeting.
The weekly guest speakers were by far the best aspect of the class. Hearing from professionals in a variety of active campaigns was extremely valuable.

This class is awesome! There are many speakers brought in, but Hank does a great job of focusing them on campaigns, so we get a well-rounded look at what running an environmental advocacy campaign is all about. I learned a ton in this class.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think this course needs to be advertised a little differently. It is not just about campaigns - it is about critical thinking, problem solving, communicating, negotiating -all skills that FESers need! I think the speakers are advertised a lot more than these skills. The skills might be attractive to a broader population at FES.
A small thing, but the readings were often not available until just a few days before class. It would be helpful to have all the readings available at the beginning of the semester.

More clear indication that students can have dinner with the speakers. I feel like it was mentioned in passing at the beginning of the semester and we all forgot about it/didn't realize it was a real option.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I think the balance of time between the speakers' presentations and discussion time was good.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I would like to utilize campaigns in my professional career.

I see myself going into environmental advocacy work and this class fit in perfectly with my career path. It's a great professional skills class but also had some theoretical basis, which is a fun combo.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I have some experience in working on environmental campaigns and I would like to continue working on, and perhaps leading, these campaigns in the future.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: YES - above! Better writer, communicator, negotiator, and problem-solver.
Yes
This class greatly exceeded my expectations and gave me a clear picture of different ways to campaign.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I am glad there was no group work - I think it is great that this course allows you to improve/grow/advance independently and individually based on your own interests. One of the few classes that have allowed me to do so.

I thought that perhaps the best part of the course was when we got together and simulated a campaign project planning meeting. We all assumed different roles and acted as though we were planning out an entire environmental campaign. This gave us real insight into how this process works in the professional world. I would suggest having more such exercises in this class in the future.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you're at all interested in campaigning, whether it's related to environmental, environmental justice, or health issues, I fully recommend that you take this class. There are so many aspects to campaigning, that you'll definitely leave the course having learned a lot.

I'm not interested in campaign work at all and I am extremely happy with my decision to take this class. I have been given the opportunity to work on so many communication skills on a variety of environmental topics in a great environment. It is taught by a practitioner -- and if you've never taken a class with a "non-academic", you must. This class had a slightly above-average workload but to get the most out of the class it was necessary.
Take this course! Start your final paper early!
Take it! It's very valuable to understanding how environmental (and other) change is made in both the US and globally. Plus, you get to meet some incredible campaigners.

Absolutely take it! Hank is the best--he really cares about his students and is great to talk to about career paths. This class is really about getting stuff done. Lots of FES classes focus on the problems, few focus on solutions. So, if you're interested in changing the world, here's a good class to start.
